intro: Agalinis microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, often found in prairies and open woodlands. Agalinis microphylla is a perennial herb that blooms from late spring to early summer.
